lines.text: Magnetic fields created by electric currents
Force with currents in same direction
Field applies force on moving charges

secText:
Enduring Understandings:
1. Electric currents create magnetic fields around them. The right-hand rule can be used to determine the direction of the magnetic field created by an electric current.
2. Two current-carrying wires placed close together exert a force on each other and the wires attract.
3. Electric motors generate currents that create magnetic fields.

STEM Skills:
1. Review electric current.
